intro: Hieracium stenosoma, commonly known as narrowleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, flat-topped clusters, typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium stenosoma is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to moderate grazing.
